sub_title: Lecturer Human Resources and Talent Development at Saxion University of Applied Sciences and at Open Universiteit
summary: Lecturer, trainer and researcher in the field of occupational and skills development, career guidance and development and employment services. Teaching Bachelor, Post Bachelor and Masters Students (HRM/HRD and Applied Psychology). Main experience lies in the development and implementation of modules and curricular tracks for the HRM Bachelor program and courses and training programs for organisations, both profit and non-profit in the field of (inclusive) HRM, HRD, Labour Market Development, Career Development, Career Guidance & Counseling, Casemanagement and Supported Employment/Jobcoaching and International affairs. Research on the role of metaphor in career communication and on prevention of Early School Leaving. Owner of WA&T, Consultancy in a Demand Oriented Approach and Career Development. Co-developer of the DLM-model, a casemanagement framework  for Performance Management in professional networks. Since 2023 I am a board member of the of the NICE Foundation, the academic network for innovation in career guidance and counseling in Europe.

projects.title: DigiTrans
projects.description:
Digital transformation is a challenge that calls for actions on individual but also on institutional level in Europe. In accordance with the EU PACT FOR SKILLS the project is focusing on the development of digital skills by better tuning between the institutional actors and the individuals and their needs. Career Guidance and Counselling (CGC) practitioners play an important role bringing individuals, companies, and training providers closer together. This is especially important for disadvantaged learners who experience a digital divide.

Digital transformation is also a challenge for HE and study programs in this context. CGC practitioners as well as other professionals in the field (e. g. in-company trainers, HR experts, adult education experts) need a deeper understanding of the digital transformation and the needs in the labor market as well as the training offers and programs available.

This requires a transformation of guidance offerings and concepts systematically, I.e.: The level of digital skills; The level of needs-based training offerings in the local and regional context; The level of cooperation in networks and the methodical design for cooperation; The level of the psychological-individual situation, which should be reflected in resource orientation, encouragement and strengthening of identity.

These aspects will be reflected in the academic education and training of counselors as well as in the approach to the development of CGC services. HEI and practice need to be linked for this purpose. Networking all partners, cooperation at eye level, recognition of people as important actors, local and targeted offer development are some central approaches that will be brought together in the project.

contributors.headline: Lecturer Human Resources and Talent Development at Saxion University of Applied Sciences and at Open Universiteit

projects.title: DigiGen
projects.description:
Digitalization not only requires the acquisition of digital competencies, but also brings new working and learning models as well as innovative approaches to problem solving and decision making in companies that play a role at all management levels. DIGIGEN focuses on these challenges, but in particular on professional career counseling for women in leadership positions regarding digital competence development by HR professionals and career counselors. The project has a duration of three years and comprises five overarching work packages to achieve the project aims.

The core aim is developing, testing and evaluating a holistic and scientifically based continuing education program for HR professionals and career counselors. This includes didactic principles, modules and materials for conducting training through various and multi-based channels. Only appropriately qualified HR professionals and career counselors can provide professional career counseling for women in leadership positions in the area of digital competencies.

projects.title: CONNECT!
projects.description:
In Europe more than 220 million people are employed, working in smaller or larger companies. Alongside their working life people more usually need to adjust and develop their career. Lifelong Career Guidance and related services are a relevant mean in this context (EU resolution 2004; 2008). In face of demographic change, forthcoming digitalization and individualization, economic crisis, global competition and skills shortage many organizations around Europe are coming under increasing pressure to find and keep talented employees at all levels of skills who bring the right qualification, competence and motivation. At the same time employees get mobile, search for attractive, stable and future-oriented job opportunities and need support to access labour offers all around Europe.

Students and professionals as (future) HR experts and practitioners, scholars in University and trainers in VET sector, counsellors and coaches in public or private services play a key role for the implementation of the envisaged change. CONNECT! will address them as direct target groups by courses and trainings. Career topics will be integrated in study programs in different disciplines and interdisciplinary study programs. Indirect targets are the more than 220 million employees (individual beneficiaries). Being aware of the fact that of course the project cannot reach all these people, it aims to make a difference in the future practice of career development in enterprises. The target group includes employees of all age, all level of education and qualification as of hierarchy. This includes explicitly those employees who face special difficulties and risks. VET students and trainees from higher education sector are of special interest.

projects.title: Xpeditie Participatie
projects.description: Development of a methodology for creative problem solving based on the expedition concept. Shared value, an into-the-box approach, followed by out-of-the-box actions lead to realistic prototype level outcomes based on commitment and ownership.
